text: John Logie Baird performed the first test of a working television system. It delivered a grayscale 30-line vertically scanned image, at five frames per second. After a ventriloquist's dummy appeared on screen, 20-year-old William Edward Taynton became first person televised in full tonal range.
ENIAC was shut down for the last time. After 11 years running at 5,000 operations a second and taking up 1,000 square feet of floor space, it deserved its retirement.
US President Bill Clinton signed amendments to the Freedom of Information Act requiring the US government to make electronic documents available online.
